primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Master (God/Christ) returns to his household (the world/church) to reclaim his own and judge the fruit of the inhabitants.

subject.identificatie: God / The One Who Comes (Jesus Christ)
tekstueel_bewijs: He is the one who gathered its members and assigned a place to each.
He put the whole operation in motion.

object.identificatie: The New Creation / The Kingdom / Salvation of the Hearer
tekstueel_bewijs: A power from outside is coming... able to make a new creation.

zender.identificatie: God the Father / The Divine Will
tekstueel_bewijs: The witness is from God; the light is from God; the preaching is from God.

ontvanger.identificatie: The Church / The 'Brood of Vipers' / The Hearer
tekstueel_bewijs: People who have no capacity of ourselves to save ourselves.
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver (the household) waiting for the Subject (the Master).

helper.identificatie: John the Baptist / The Holy Spirit / The Word
tekstueel_bewijs: The preacher is nothing; the Word is everything.
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject; the Spirit is the power-source (Pouvoir).
helper.rol_van_geest: External help that grants the power to repent.

tegenstander.identificatie: The Powers of Darkness / Sin / Human Self-Sufficiency
tekstueel_bewijs: The kingdom of God is in head-on collision with the powers of darkness.
Our own possessions and earthly status symbols.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just a bad habit but a 'collision of two forces' and 'the works of darkness' requiring a divine invasion.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Church/Hearer keeping watch and bearing fruit (Repentance).
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Church / The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics) is explicitly fueled by the primary (soteriology). We repent 'because he is coming'.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: John the Baptist/Word → Christ → Powers of Darkness/Sin

voorbeelden_god_subject: He gave it its reason for being.
He will come in the future.
God gives good deeds and inner strength.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We put him on a cross.
We Christians are going to be weaned away.
The church keeps her own deep inner rhythms.

voorbeelden: He must not find us asleep.
The church has to take a beating.
The Advent clock tells the church what time it is.
I need power from outside myself to make me different.
People who have no capacity of ourselves to save ourselves.
It is God’s power that gives... faith and repentance.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes that the hearer lacks the 'Pouvoir' (Power) to fulfill the 'Devoir' (Duty), which is then supplied by the Subject (God).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the 'Absence of God' (~S1) through the 'Axe at the root' (S2) to the 'Power from outside' (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in the 'One Who Comes' who bridges the gap between our incapacity and God's holiness.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; the axe and the fire are not softened.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It explicitly denies human capacity and identifies God as the source of even the response (repentance) he requires.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: It is God’s power that gives good deeds... and even our repentance.
The kingdom of God is in head-on collision with the powers of darkness.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: John the Baptist is used not as a moral model to imitate, but as a 'spotlight' pointing away from himself to Christ.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: John is a witness to the Light, not the Light himself.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief through the realization that the 'must' is met by God's 'can'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic sanctification; God is the author and finisher.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'crisis' of the Master's absence to the 'power' of his arrival is perfectly integrated.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'Stay awake' (Command) and 'No capacity of ourselves' (Incapacity).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Head-on collision with the powers of darkness.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'Pouvoir-faire' that the Law's 'Devoir-faire' demands.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Total; sin is an 'absence of God' and a 'root' that needs an axe.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is driven by God's action. The hearer is positioned as a servant who is incapable of staying awake without the Master's own power.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Strong emphasis on Pouvoir (Power) over Devoir (Duty).
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain this; it is the hallmark of grace-oriented preaching.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Continue to frame imperatives within the indicative of God's arrival.

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The opponent is already sufficiently cosmic.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in maintaining the 'God as Subject' rule while delivering sharp ethical demands.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis might focus on the 'spotlight' metaphor, Greimas reveals that John functions as a 'Helper' actant whose value is entirely derived from the 'Subject'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Greek 'metanoia'; semiotics shows that 'metanoia' is a modal competence (Pouvoir) granted by the Sender.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas exposes that even when the preacher says 'You must repent,' the underlying structure identifies God as the one who 'gives' the repentance, preventing moralism.

appendices.notities: The sermon follows Fleming Rutledge's grammar of grace almost perfectly.
